definition: lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
general/commander-in-chief (military)/king (chess piece)/to command/to lead
to desire/to invite/to request
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
surname Cuo

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
surname Cuo

sentences.english: Actually some matters miss one time are doomed to make the best of a bad situation.
sentences.chinese: 其實有些事錯過一次就註定將錯就錯。

sentences.english: Life is very short, I am willing to go along with you.
sentences.chinese: 一輩子很短，我願意和你將錯就錯。

definition: to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
(idiom) (of a good outcome) unanticipated/serendipitous/fortuitous
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
impossible/can't be done/no can do/unable to accomplish
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to force someone to do something
to fail to grasp the main points
to tease/to poke fun at
to take a lot of trouble (idiom); painstaking/at the cost of a lot of effort
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to be at a loss for words/speechless
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
lit. to clasp the Buddha's feet when danger arises (idiom); fig. to profess devotion only when in trouble/doing things at the last minute/making a hasty last-minute effort
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
lit. to chop the nail and slice the iron (idiom)/fig. resolute and decisive/unhesitating/categorical
